--- title: "Tidy Tuesday (05/30/2023): Centenarians" author: "Dave Tirtariyadi" date: "2023-05-30" categories: [tidy tuesday] execute: message: false warning: false cache: true --- In this post, I analyze data on the oldest centenarians in the world! The main dataset was produced by frankiethull and can be found [here](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2023/2023-05-30). The dataset contains the oldest 100 known verified male and female centenarians. ![](old-pic.jpg) ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/load-data-pkgs_e4dcb47899bca947eb514f01975828b0'} ::: Let's skim the dataset first. ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/skim-data_4292af1802fa0be8d5a0523a9fe5b2c0'} ::: {.cell-output-display}
Data summary
Name centenarians
Number of rows 200
Number of columns 8
_______________________
Column type frequency:
character 4
Date 2
numeric 2
________________________
Group variables None
**Variable type: character**
skim_variable n_missing complete_rate min max empty n_unique whitespace
name 0 1 9 31 0 200 0
place_of_death_or_residence 0 1 4 25 0 34 0
gender 0 1 4 6 0 2 0
still_alive 0 1 5 8 0 2 0
**Variable type: Date**
skim_variable n_missing complete_rate min max median n_unique
birth_date 0 1.00 1856-06-15 1911-12-05 1900-05-23 199
death_date 12 0.94 1968-03-21 2023-04-17 2014-01-02 186
**Variable type: numeric**
skim_variable n_missing complete_rate mean sd p0 p25 p50 p75 p100 hist
rank 0 1 50.44 28.90 1.00 25.75 50.50 75.25 100.00 ▇▇▇▇▇
age 0 1 114.06 1.93 111.46 112.26 114.57 115.29 122.45 ▇▇▂▁▁
::: ::: We see that there are eight variables in the dataset, including `place_of_death_or_residence`, `gender`, and `birth_date`. Cool thing: the average age of the 100 oldest male and female centenarians is **114 years old**! # Exploratory data analysis ## Location Let's first take a look at where the 100 oldest male and female centenarians come from. ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/top-ten-country_13164e1e5fc33a84a852cc72bc0441a2'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Top Ten Countries with the Highest Number of Centenarians
Country Count
United States 66
Japan 46
France 9
Italy 9
Spain 9
United Kingdom 9
Brazil 6
Canada 5
Portugal 5
Mexico 4
````` ::: ::: We see that the **United States** and **Japan** dominate the list of countries, accounting for more than half of the entire dataset of 200 centenarians! How about if we analyze on the continent-level? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/continent-rank_0b906647d3ac64174f5972a3a499794b'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/continent-rank-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Let's take a closer look at centenarians from the United States and Japan. What does the gender distribution look like? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/gender-us-japan_8d3defb693398bb243a3ec82ac17b04e'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Gender Distribution among Centenarians in the United States and Japan
Country Female Male
Japan 25 21
United States 36 30
````` ::: ::: We see that there is an almost equal split between male and female in Japan and the United States. ## Birth date Are centenarians more likely to be born on a certain month? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/month-dist_387bfc01f4a496ac50fe2b613173f9f4'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/month-dist-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: There's no clear winner here, but the top two months are **May** and **August**. Were centenarians who were born earlier in history more like to reach an older age? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/age-vs-birth-date_c0cb5b0990d7ddd54479ae526cd6283f'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/age-vs-birth-date-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: There does not seem to be a clear trend between age and birth date, but the plot above demonstrates that the age of female centenarians are generally greater than male centenarians. So, maybe it is true that men's lives are shorter than women's!
